metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39188 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in include/asm-generic/tlb.h in the Linux kernel before 5.19. Because of a race condition (unmap_mapping_range versus munmap), a device driver can free a page while it still has stale TLB entries. This only occurs in situations with VM_PFNMAP VMAs. Jann Horn discovered a race condition existed in the Linux kernel when unmapping VMAs in certain situations, resulting in possible use-after-free vulnerabilities. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: sbeattie> for backports, see JannH's post to the stable list rodrigo-zaiden> for 5.4 kernels, two follow up commits are needed. in upstream they are: b67fbebd4cf9 and b67fbebd4cf98, they were adjusted in ubuntu kernel to match the needs.
